error: System.QueryException: List has no rows for assignment to SObject
solution: Use a list to receive query results and check if list is empty before accessing element
notes: Avoid single-SObject assignment when result may be empty

error: System.QueryException: List has more than 1 row for assignment to SObject
solution: Use list (or LIMIT 1 + ensure only one result) or handle multiple results appropriately
notes: When query returns multiple records instead of single

error: System.ListException: List index out of bounds: 0
solution: Check list.size() before accessing by index; avoid direct get(0) without check
notes: Always verify list is non-empty before accessing

error: System.NullPointerException: Attempt to de-reference a null object
solution: Ensure variable/object is not null before using, add null checks
notes: Initialize variables and perform null‑safe checks

error: System.DmlException: Insert failed. First exception on row 0; first error: REQUIRED_FIELD_MISSING
solution: Populate all required fields (e.g. Name for Contacts/Accounts) before insert/update
notes: Ensure mandatory fields compliance

error: System.DmlException: Insert failed. First exception on row 0; first error: INVALID_FIELD_FOR_INSERT_UPDATE
solution: Do not include Id or read-only fields when inserting; use update when updating
notes: Ensure correct fields used for DML

error: System.DmlException: Insert failed. First exception on row 0; first error: MIXED_DML_OPERATION
solution: Separate setup and non‑setup object DMLs into different transactions (use @future or queueable)
notes: Avoid mixing setup and data objects in same transaction

error: System.SObjectException: SObject row was retrieved via SOQL without querying the requested field
solution: Include the required field in the SOQL SELECT clause before accessing
notes: Always SELECT needed fields before access

error: System.LimitException: Too many SOQL queries: 101
solution: Bulkify code: move SOQL outside loops, use collections/maps
notes: Respect governor limits; avoid SOQL inside loops

error: System.LimitException: Too many DML statements: 151
solution: Bulkify DML: collect records in list and perform one DML
notes: Respect DML limits in batch/trigger context

error: System.LimitException: Apex CPU time limit exceeded
solution: Optimize logic, reduce loops, avoid heavy operations in single transaction
notes: For heavy tasks consider async processing (future/batch)

error: System.QueryException: Non-selective query against large object type
solution: Add filters/index, avoid unfiltered queries on large tables
notes: Ensure SOQL is selective when objects are large

error: System.StringException: Invalid Id
solution: Validate Id format before using; avoid passing null or invalid strings where Id expected
notes: Validate ID strings before use

error: System.NullPointerException during LWC call
solution: Use null-safe navigation or checks before accessing Apex-returned data in LWC
notes: Validate data before use in JS front‑end

error: SOQL assignment error after delete or missing record
solution: Check existence of record before assignment; use safe query + null/size checks
notes: Avoid assuming existence of data

error: Permission/Access error (NoAccessException / insufficient privileges)
solution: Ensure user profile or permission sets grant object/field access
notes: Verify sharing, field-level security, and profile permissions

error: Invalid field error (invalid field for DML)
solution: Use correct API field names; ensure schema alignment
notes: Check metadata/schema before operations

error: System.DmlException: Update failed. First exception on row 0; first error: FIELD_CUSTOM_VALIDATION_EXCEPTION
solution: Check validation rules before update, handle exceptions appropriately
notes: Consider try/catch for updates

error: System.AsyncException: Future method cannot be called from a future or batch context
solution: Avoid calling future methods from another async context
notes: Chain async operations using Queueable jobs instead

error: System.LimitException: Too many callouts: 100
solution: Reduce HTTP callouts per transaction or move some callouts to async context
notes: Use Continuations or Batch Apex for many callouts

error: System.CalloutException: You have uncommitted work pending. Please commit or rollback before calling out
solution: Do DML operations after callouts or move callouts before DML
notes: Avoid mixing DML and callouts in the same transaction

error: System.DmlException: Delete failed. First exception on row 0; first error: CANNOT_DELETE_ACTIVATED_PRODUCT2
solution: Cannot delete activated product; deactivate first
notes: Understand business object constraints

error: System.LimitException: Too many script statements: 2000000
solution: Optimize code, reduce unnecessary loops and recursive calls
notes: Check for infinite recursion or large loops

error: System.LimitException: Too many future calls: 50
solution: Reduce number of future calls per transaction
notes: Combine tasks into fewer future methods or queueable jobs

error: System.DmlException: Insert failed. First exception on row 0; first error: DUPLICATE_VALUE
solution: Check for duplicate rules before inserting
notes: Use upsert or check existence before insert

error: System.ListException: Remove failed. List index out of bounds
solution: Check list indices before remove operation
notes: Always verify list boundaries before modification

error: System.StringException: String too long
solution: Truncate strings or validate length before DML
notes: Salesforce has max field length limits

error: System.DmlException: Update failed. First exception on row 0; first error: FIELD_INTEGRITY_EXCEPTION
solution: Ensure required parent or related record exists
notes: Foreign key or relationship missing

error: System.QueryException: Invalid query locator
solution: Check batch size and cursor usage when querying large datasets
notes: Use smaller batch sizes or iterate carefully

error: System.DmlException: Insert failed. First exception on row 0; first error: CANNOT_INSERT_UPDATE_ACTIVATE_ENTITY
solution: Check workflow rules or triggers that may block insert/update
notes: Review active triggers and validation rules

error: System.AsyncException: Batch Apex job limit exceeded
solution: Reduce number of queued batch jobs
notes: Submit batches sequentially, monitor limits

error: System.LimitException: Too many SOSL queries: 20
solution: Reduce number of SOSL queries per transaction
notes: Consider combining searches or using more selective queries

error: System.QueryException: Malformed query: unexpected token
solution: Check SOQL syntax carefully
notes: Avoid typos and incorrect keywords

error: System.NullPointerException: sObject is null in trigger
solution: Ensure sObject instance exists before use
notes: Initialize variables and check trigger context

error: System.DmlException: Upsert failed. First exception on row 0; first error: REQUIRED_FIELD_MISSING
solution: Populate mandatory fields for upsert operation
notes: Ensure all required fields exist

error: System.DmlException: Merge failed. First exception on row 0; first error: CANNOT_MERGE_RECORD
solution: Ensure records can be merged and meet criteria
notes: Check ownership and relationship constraints

error: System.SObjectException: Cannot read field from null sObject
solution: Check null before accessing sObject fields
notes: Add defensive null checks

error: System.LimitException: Too many query rows: 50000
solution: Reduce query size or process in batches
notes: Use batch processing for large datasets

error: System.DmlException: Upsert failed due to unique constraint
solution: Ensure no duplicates for unique fields
notes: Check external IDs and unique fields

error: System.QueryException: Aggregate query returned more than 2000 rows
solution: Use LIMIT clause or filter to reduce aggregate query results
notes: Salesforce aggregation limit

error: System.DmlException: Cannot execute DML on setup object from non-setup context
solution: Use @future or separate transaction for setup object
notes: Avoid mixing setup & non-setup objects

error: System.CalloutException: HTTP request failed
solution: Verify endpoint, authentication, and limits
notes: Check remote site settings and callout authorization

error: System.AsyncException: Queueable job limit exceeded
solution: Reduce number of queued jobs per transaction
notes: Check for chaining and batch limits

error: System.DmlException: Insert failed. First exception on row 0; first error: INVALID_TYPE_ON_FIELD_IN_RECORD
solution: Use correct field type for insert/update
notes: Match field type in schema

error: System.StringException: String exceeded maximum length
solution: Trim strings or validate input length
notes: Ensure input fits field constraints

error: System.PermissionException: Insufficient Privileges
solution: Grant object, field, or Apex class access
notes: Check profiles, permission sets, and sharing rules

error: System.DmlException: Cannot update read-only field
solution: Do not attempt to update read-only fields
notes: Some fields are auto-calculated or formula fields

error: System.QueryException: Unsupported operator in WHERE clause
solution: Check SOQL WHERE operators are valid
notes: Avoid unsupported operators

error: System.LimitException: Too many chained jobs in a single transaction
solution: Reduce chained Queueable jobs
notes: Salesforce limit on async job chaining

error: System.DmlException: Insert failed. First exception on row 0; first error: CANNOT_INSERT_ACTIVATE_ENTITY
solution: Deactivate conflicting workflow/process before insert
notes: Check active workflows and processes

error: System.LimitException: Too many future calls in a single execution context
solution: Combine future calls or use Queueable/Batch
notes: Respect limit of 50 future calls per transaction

error: System.DmlException: Insert failed. First exception on row 0; first error: REQUIRED_FIELD_MISSING, Required fields are missing: [Name]
solution: Populate all required fields (e.g. Name for Accounts or Contacts) before insert/update
notes: Ensure mandatory fields compliance; provide Name for Account before insert
